body_html: Fix in progress. To be clear the line: model_split = tf.split(model_input, [4], axis=1)[0] shouldn't work; it would need to be model_split = tf.split(model_input, [10], axis=1)[0]. You will now get an error either when the op is created if the dimensions are known or at runtime if they are not.
body_text: Fix in progress.  To be clear the line: model_split = tf.split(model_input, [4], axis=1)[0] shouldn't work; it would need to be model_split = tf.split(model_input, [10], axis=1)[0].  You will now get an error either when the op is created if the dimensions are known or at runtime if they are not.
body: Fix in progress.  To be clear the line: `model_split = tf.split(model_input, [4], axis=1)[0]` shouldn't work; it would need to be `model_split = tf.split(model_input, [10], axis=1)[0]`.  You will now get an error either when the op is created if the dimensions are known or at runtime if they are not.
